title: karylnorman_dta_sheetmusic_california_1921.jpg
creator: Con Conrad and Cliff Friend
description: Sheet music cover for "California," a popular song composed by Con Conrad and Cliff Friend and published by Jerome H. Remick and Company. The cover features Karyl Norman, "The Creole Fashion Plate," a renowned female impersonator and vaudeville performer of the 1920s. This piece represents the intersection of popular music and gender performance in early 20th century American entertainment, showcasing how cross-dressing performers were prominently featured in mainstream sheet music marketing.
subject: Karyl Norman "The Creole Fashion Plate"
citation: Conrad, Con, and Friend, Cliff. "California." Leaflet. 1921.  Digital Transgender Archive, https://www.digitaltransgenderarchive.net/files/2f75r8391 (accessed October 30, 2025).
relation: Arts and entertainment occupations, Crossdressers, Female impersonators

title: karylnorman_dta_sheetmusic_midnight_1923.jpg
creator: Lew Pollack and Sidney Mitchell
description: Sheet music for "Midnight Rose" by composers Lew Pollack and Sidney Mitchell, featuring Karyl Norman. This 1923 publication captures Norman at the height of their career as one of vaudeville's most celebrated female impersonators, demonstrating the commercial appeal and cultural acceptance of gender-nonconforming performers in 1920s American popular culture.
subject: Karyl Norman "The Creole Fashion Plate"
citation: Pollack, Lew, and Mitchell, Sidney. "Midnight Rose." Leaflet. 1923.  Digital Transgender Archive, https://www.digitaltransgenderarchive.net/files/4j03d0053 (accessed October 30, 2025).
relation: Arts and entertainment occupations, Crossdressers, Female impersonators

title: karylnorman_dta_sheetmusic_nobodylied_1921.jpg
creator:
Hyatt Berry, Karly Norman, and 
Edwin J. Weber
description: Sheet music for "Nobody Lied," notably co-written by Karyl Norman themselves alongside Hyatt Berry and Edwin J. Weber, and published by Jerome H. Remick and Company. This piece is particularly significant as it showcases Norman not only as a performing artist but as a creative contributor to the popular music landscape, highlighting the multifaceted talents of this pioneering entertainer.
subject: Karyl Norman "The Creole Fashion Plate"
citation: Berry, Hyatt, Norman, Karly, and Weber, Edwin J.. "Nobody Lied ." Leaflet. 1921.  Digital Transgender Archive, https://www.digitaltransgenderarchive.net/files/6969z098w (accessed October 30, 2025).
relation: Arts and entertainment occupations, Crossdressers, Female impersonators

title: karylnorman_ua_sheetmusic_allthatineed_1921.jpg
creator: Lester Santly and Abel Baer
description: Fox trot sheet music composed by Lester Santly and Abel Baer, published by Leo Feist and featuring Karyl Norman. This dance-oriented piece reflects the fox trot craze of the early 1920s and Norman's marketability across various musical genres, illustrating the performer's broad appeal in the golden age of vaudeville and popular song.
subject: Karyl Norman "The Creole Fashion Plate"
object title:
Karyl Norman All That I Need 
Is You Fox Trot Song
citation: American Vaudeville Museum Collection (MS 421), MS 365 Box 6 Folder 2, , courtesy of University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections.
relation: David Soren Popular Sheet Music Collection

title: karylnorman_uu_image_drag_1919.jpg
creator:
Photographer or Printer: Apeda 
studio New York
description: Black and white studio photograph taken by Apeda Studio in New York City, depicting Karyl Norman in a dark fringed and beaded dress with sequined wrap and hat. This striking portrait captures the glamour and sophistication of Norman's stage persona during the late 1910s, providing visual documentation of theatrical transvestism and female impersonation as established entertainment forms in American vaudeville culture.
subject:
Karyl Norman, Cross Dressing, 
Theatrical Transvestism, Vaudeville, Theater, Drag
